entry.title: The History of Cinnamon Sorrow
entry.summary:
Author: ElvenSorceress

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 84,602Chapters: 9/10Kudos: 150

Summary: “Now that you’re here, we should discuss Christopher staying with us for the foreseeable future. It would be so much better for him. He should be able to have a mother’s care. I’m really the only mother he’s ever known.”Eddie rankles at the words. But knew she’d say it. He’s so fucking tired.He can’t even imagine what his mother would say if she knew Eddie was in love with a man and that Chris will probably never have any mother except Shannon. “I was guessing Chris will want to stay where he is. For now. I don’t want to uproot him. Not when he’s happy and doing well.”She actually smiles this time. For real. “That’s a very caring, wise decision. I’m proud of you.”God. Fucking god. It hurts but it also feels like a rush of hope and Eddie could scream. Or cry. Or both. And doesn’t know which he should do, but he’s definitely dangling over a 5000 foot cliff somewhere. Why does something he inexplicably wants so badly make him feel like such shit?~Eddie arrives in El Paso to mend his family and confront his childhood.

entry.title: Those he left behind
entry.summary:
Author: DaniWib

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 304Chapters: 1/5Kudos: 12

Summary: All Buck wanted was to be with his family, but things weren’t the same after the lawsuit. He was sidelined, buried in chores, still on the outs with the 118, especially Bobby and Eddie. Unwilling to give up on them, Buck kept his head down and did his job.Until he died, all alone, while his team was out on a call.Grief and guilt consume them. They should have been there, should have seen the signs— should have saved him. But Bobby had let his anger blind him, believing there’d be time to make things right. And Eddie had stayed silent, convinced there’d be a someday. Now, Buck is gone, and they can never make it right.They weren’t the only ones Buck left behind, however. When a group of Navy SEALs arrives at Buck’s funeral, their presence brings more than just surprise. It brings truths the 118 never saw coming, and more grief than they ever could have imagined.[Fic is complete and will be updated weekly on Sunday nights, AEST]

entry.title: The Ghost of You
entry.summary:
Author: bvddiesbro

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,025Chapters: 7/20Kudos: 467

Summary: Evan "Buck" Buckley thought he had left his past behind when he traded his Navy fatigues for turnouts. For years, he’s buried the memories—of war zones, of a lost lover, of the life he swore he'd never return to. But when a series of arson attacks target classified SCIF sites across Los Angeles, his past comes back to haunt him.NCIS are called to investigate and Buck’s carefully constructed web of lies begins to crack when Special Agent Sam Hanna arrives at Station 118—because Buck knows him. Sam was once his teammate, his mentor and his sudden reappearance is no coincidence.When a grainy surveillance video reveals a face Buck thought he’d never see again, the ground shifts beneath his feet. Zack, the man he mourned, the man he watched die, is alive.Working alongside NCIS and his old SEAL Team, Buck finds himself walking a dangerous tightrope. The deeper he gets, the more he risks everything—his job, his family, his friendships and the life he’s built with Eddie and Christopher.But secrets can’t stay buried forever.

entry.title: A Symphony of Longing
entry.summary:
Author: Taylorm1509

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 96,772Chapters: 13/14Kudos: 187

Summary: Buck found himself immersed in the world of writing, dedicating countless hours to crafting songs that served as a personal diary. His lyrics often revolved around Eddie, who had become the focal point of his existence. Through his words, Buck explored memories of their connection, delving into his emotions, and expressed the turmoil that weighed heavily on his heart. The absence of Eddie was a constant ache, and Buck frequently poured his longing into his writing, capturing the essence of his feelings in every verse.ORBuck returns to a cherished pastime: singing, to occupy his time after Eddie's departure. His music begins to attract attention and Buck is determined to keep his music identity a secret from everyone. Eddie begins to rekindle his relationship with his son, Christopher. Buck and Eddie both struggle with their feelings for one another.

entry.title: Take the Lead
entry.summary:
Author: Veronae

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,750Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 43

Summary: “I didn’t know you could dance like that,” Buck said, his hands lingering on Eddie’s body. Firm muscles rippled beneath his fingers. “What was that, waltzing?”Grunting softly, Eddie drew back a little and smiled. “Foxtrot,” he replied.Before he knew he was speaking, Buck said, “Can you show me?”Glancing at him, Eddie’s eyes gleamed. “You bet.”

entry.title: you really know how to dance
entry.summary:
Author: lethargicWaste

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,322Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 18

Summary: Eddie’s eyes moved toward the center of the room, drawn by the chaotic energy of two women who had effectively become the centerpiece of the party. They were dancing—or at least, they were trying to. There were no smooth, flowing movements one might expect to see in a dance, only something frantic, disjointed—like they were untangling themselves in real-time, fighting the rhythm and each other in some strange, drunken cacophony. Their flushed faces were lit up by the soft, flickering light as one of them pulled at the hem of her shirt like she was about to throw it into the crowd.“I can do that,” Buck grinned, eyes half lidded, and there was something in the way Buck’s voice slid out, thick with alcohol and amusement, that made the heat in Eddie’s chest flare up again.Maybe it was the alcohol, or the heat of Buck’s body, seeping in through the layers of fabric between them, but Eddie felt a strange, reckless energy unfurl in him—itching under his skin.“Prove it.”

entry.title: Serendipity
entry.summary:
Author: bluegreen_118

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 33,634Chapters: 20/?Kudos: 110

Summary: Evan “Buck” Buckley and his older sister Maddie were adopted by firefighter captain Bobby Nash and his retired cop wife Athena Grant. Buck grew up hard of hearing as long as he could remember. To communicate he speaks and uses American Sign Language, and his sister is completely deaf she only uses American Sign Language.*Eddie Diaz grew up in Texas but when he gets in a car wreck his wife passes away and their five year old son loses his hearing. Eddie found a school for the deaf in Los Angeles. With that he packs their bags and moves to LA.*What happens when two walks of life meet?

entry.title: This Place Could Be Beautiful, Right? You Could Make This Place Beautiful.
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 54,585Chapters: 5/10Kudos: 21

Summary: Life is no longer the same for Eddie and Buck. The last seven years of comfort and familiarity are threatened to be washed away and in its place now is a physical seperation by hundred of miles.But alas, they trudge on.Buck learns how to love himself amidst loneliness and how to let that be enough.Eddie grapples with his shifting identity and what it means to be unsure of yourself in a world that seems to be so unforgiving.Both men find love in one another and in their diverging lives. And even in the weeks and months to come, as they make their way back to one another, they realize that loving themselves is the only foundation their relationship can rest on.OR: Buck remains in LA with his lingering feelings in this new chapter of his life without Eddie by his side.Eddie is in Texas working on his relationship with Christopher.When you are a parent, you are trying to sell the world to your children.‘Any decent realtor, walking you through a shithole, chirps on about good bones.'And both Buck and Eddie realize that to love the world, they must first love who they are in it.

entry.title: Buck's House
entry.summary:
Author: nlpiersee

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 37,487Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 75

Summary: “This is nice, Buck.” Albert said, looking around. Buck watched him for a minute to see if he was serious or joking, but he was just smiling at the pictures Buck had hung up that Chris had drawn or had made him get printed. “I really appreciate you letting me stay here.” “No problem.” Buck shrugged, heading for the bedroom to get his bag. “I’m also glad that your boyfriend isn’t threatened by me.” Albert continued and Buck promptly tripped through the door to the bedroom and he heard Eddie do the same in the kitchen. “Oh my gosh, are you guys ok?” “Good!” Eddie called, coughing a little. “Yeah, all good.” Buck grunted as he pushed himself back up. “Sorry, I was just trying to make a joke. I know I’m not a threat when that’s the type of person you’re with. I mean, good for you, Buck. You too, Eddie. You’re both very lucky.” Albert apologized.

entry.title: The Chosen and the Cursed
entry.summary:
Author: ThisGayGeek22

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 59,708Chapters: 10/15Kudos: 48

Summary: A solar eclipse marks the beginning.A fire changes everything.And one impossible moment shatters the illusion of normalcy.When Buck is gravely injured during a rescue, something ancient stirs—something buried deep in his blood. As his body begins to heal at a rate no doctor can explain, the 118 is pulled into a world of magic, secrets, and destiny.Eddie feels the shift too—power waking in his bones, in his blood. And the bond between him and Buck? It was never just friendship. Not really.As the veil between worlds thins, Buck and Eddie must confront the truth of who they are—what they were always meant to be—and the powerful connection tying them together.This was never just an accident.It was the beginning.
